Locked up by Emplate, Escapade meets his other prisoner before offering up her self when D.O.A. demands one of them come to dinner. Forced to wear the dress of a past victim, Escapade attends the meal, where Emplate reveals that while he plans to eat and kill her slowly, he hopes their relationship can remain amicable. He explains that time moves differently in his realm, and that part of him hopes that her friends will rescue her. Emplate informs Escapade of his origins as Marius St. Croix, son of a wealthy family whose life was ruined when he killed his mother after she discovered the onset of his vampiric mutant ability. In their cell, the mysterious prisoner advises Escapade to keep their host talking, but his memory is too damaged by Emplate to give her more information. He asks her to let Emplate finish him off, but Escapade refuses to let him pass. At another dinner with Emplate, he reveals that he has chosen Escapade specifically for use of her powers, and after drinking from her looks on towards new ventures. Back at the Academy, Captain Marvel asks the students about Escapade and is surprised to hear, for the first time, about the Midnight Chapel and the Lighthouse, and then again to learn of M'Kraan, who guest instructor Iceman claims some familiarity with. Hazmat is left in charge while Captain Marvel and Iceman go to consult with mystical experts and people who have previously experience with Emplate. Bloodline is ready to set off with Walpurgis and the Asgardian stake that was able to damage Emplate previously, but is halted by Hazmat, who insists on joining her.

Years ago, the daughter of Red Skull hurls homophobic insults and attempts to break down captive Arnie Roth to demoralize Captain America. In the present, an angry mob leads a protest outside the Arnie Roth Community Center, incited by internet celebrity Cherry Crane, secretly Sinthea Shmidt. Marcus Wetherell shows up to report on the incident as many community members try to continue with their day in spite of the protests. Things go sideways when the protest becomes violent, with protestors entering the center, setting fire and beginning to shoot. During the chaos, a HYDRA agent activates Cherry Crane's fiancé into a rampaging monster. Kid Juggernaut fights him off and saves Marcus Wetherell, earning a savior's kiss before he goes to check on Aaron. Leading civilians out onto the roof away from the flames, Mysteriant is attacked by Sinthea, who holds him dangling over the edge.

The first night at Avengers Academy begins a restless one - Moon Girl meets the Red Goblin as she goes to feed Devil Dinosaur some cookies at his paddock. After relating over their bonds, Red Goblin reveals to her his secret identity: Normie Osborn, heir to Alchemax. Roommates Kid Juggernaut and Captain America stay up in their bunk bed and discuss their individual histories with their parents, before the former falls asleep during their talk. Watching a vampire movie, Bloodline and Escapade divulge their shared worry of losing identity by nature of their abilities, finding some solace before passing out on the couch together, the last of the students to fall asleep.

Captain Marvel brings the students to Van Dyne Designs in order to meet the Wasp and learn about super hero fashion. After speaking on the importance of branding, Janet Van Dyne presents Moon Girl with a new costume. She and Princess Shuri the styles and gadgets of all the students, gifting a high tech watch to Red Goblin and gloves that enable Escapade to manipulate gravity, as well as a new dress for her to wear on a first date. Unable to do much for Kid Juggernaut’s mystical armor or sense of personal style, Janet simply gifts him an underwear of the month club membership and asks him not to mention her help in regards to his fashion sense. For Bloodline, she provides silver lined boots for vampire hunting, a collar for Walpurgis and calls in a favor with Valkyrie to gift an Asgardian stake, able to track those it has made to bleed. She gives Captain America a new suit he refuses to wear, but insists on sending it home with him. Finally, she provides the students with new school uniforms. Enjoying time at the spa, Captain Marvel tells Shuri she had canceled the previously planned lesson for this field trip to afford the students an opportunity to feel like kids, and give her a chance to relax!

An encounter with the supervillain Rhinoceress makes Captain America and Kid Juggernaut late for an important date: a how-to lesson on the Fastball Special from Colossus and Wolverine! Absent from the training is Bloodline, who hears a  mysterious voice calling for aid in the Midnight Chapel. Captain Marvel pulls out Captain America, Escapade, and Red Goblin to discuss their fraught legal standings, but informs the students that they have unconditional support and safety at the Academy. In another room, Shuri teaches Moon Girl about unbreakable metals, and helps her develop a new alloy, "Lunellum", which Moon Girl uses to make Captain America a new shield that stops both bullets and magic. The students throw around the discus shaped shield as the grownups play a game that Wolverine insists is NOT strip poker.

Daily Bugle TV's Marcus Wetherell reports on the Sinister Six's ransacking of Manhattan, interviewing both Mysteriant at the scene of a corporate raid before an attack from Squid Kid ends the segment. Watching the broadcast, Avengers Academy agree they need to help, as Red Goblin stumbles in to ask for assistance in saving his brother. Captain Marvel insists the students let the Avengers handle it. Not planning to stay put, Captain America knows where to find one member of the Sinister Six, and goes to meet and sleep with Mysteriant. Noting Aaron's long absence, Bloodline checks in on Moon Girl, who she breaks out of worry that she will end up a mad scientist like Squid Kid. Back in lovers' embrace, Mysteriant pledges to help the students infiltrate and rescue Stanley Osborn, unknowingly surveilled by Squid Kid.

Years ago, as Arnie Roth lay dying, he and Steve Rogers reminisce and share affection for each other. At the Arnie Roth Community Center in the present day, Arnie’s statue is toppled by rioters. Aaron Fischer arrives at the roof to fight Sin in his new Captain America uniform. She tells him her followers plan to blow up the center and place the blame on him, however, Mysteriant disables the explosives. Defeated, Sin escapes and threatens they haven’t seen the last of her. The next day at a candlelight vigil, Captains America Steve and Aaron sit on a stoop and discuss Arnie, including a memory of him saying Kaddish for Steve’s mother, prompting Aaron to say the prayer once more.

Red Goblin and Moon Girl discuss their beliefs as they make their way alongside Kid Juggernaut to find the perfect Christmas tree on the Savage Land Cliffs. Seeing a menacing presence over the Academy, they rush back to the school. Bloodline and Escapade prepare to protect Tommy and Billy from the masked figure guarding the Midnight Chapel, before he reveals himself as Immortus, formerly Iron Lad and now Chaplain of the Midnight Expanse. He introduces them to M'Kraan, the woman from the crystal that Kid Juggernaut met during Swarm's attack. She takes the twins away to their new home while Mephisto is distracted. Meanwhile Captain America, Hazmat, and Mettle watch a Daily Bugle report on reporter Marcus Wetherell's kiss with Kid Juggernaut, prompting Captain America to storm out of the room. In Hell, Mephisto is displeased with his son Blackheart's disobedience and failure to capture the Maximoffs. He transforms him into a human being and sends him out into the world, arriving naked at the gates of Avengers Academy to the surprise of the recently returned students.

Peter leaves and changes back to Spider-Man, and soon finds himself attacked by the Punisher, who thinks that Spider-Man is a common crook just like everyone else he kills. The vigilante doesn't have much of an upper hand against Spider-Man, and the Jackal (hiding near the battle) decides to strike out. When his claws rake the back of Spider-Man's head, the Punisher calls the Jackal on his "unjust" methods of killing Spider-Man. The wall-crawler manages to get away when he stumbles off the edge of the building they are fighting on, gain control, and swing away. When the Jackal and Punisher depart, Spider-Man returns to the scene and collects the Punisher's weapon that was left behind and sees that it was made byReiss Armorers.
Spider-Man returns to his apartment. As Peter Parker, he mends his costume, unaware thatHarry Osbornis listening and suspects that Peter may know that he's decided to become theGreen Goblin. While atESU, Miles Warren has sought outMary Jane Watsonto see if she can pass along an apology to Peter over their brief run-in while he was trying to get help for her when theVulturehad captured her. At the secret hideout of the Jackal, the Punisher lashes out at the Jackal over their methods of elimination. The Punisher leaves to go theMechanic, his gun supplier, to resupply.

Punisher Kills the Marvel Universe TPB#1Previous IssueNext Issue——Reprint of animagefromPunisher Kills the Marvel Universe#1. Original art by:Steve DillonRelease DateFebruary 11, 2025Cover DateFebruary,2025Issue DetailsEditor-in-ChiefC.B. CebulskiOriginal Price$19.99Pages152ISBN978-1302964801
The take-no-prisoners vigilante Punisher sets his sights on the entire Marvel Universe — twice!
In a classic WHAT IF?-style tale by Frank Castle's signature writer, Garth Ennis, Frank Castle's family died not in a mob shootout, but during a superhuman slugfest. Armed with an arsenal of advanced weaponry, the Punisher seeks his revenge by hunting down Spider-Man, Magneto, Captain America, the Kingpin, Daredevil, Doctor Doom, the Hulk, Venom, Wolverine and more. One by one, group by group, the one-man army means to kill them all! Then, in another nightmarish reality, a terrible plague sweeps the Earth, turning everyone — human, hero, villain, god and monster — into sadistic cannibal predators. One man hunts the wasteland that was New York City, standing against the hordes of monsters who hunt the night. He is the Punisher, the Last Gun on Earth!

The beloved omnibus series collecting the classic adventures of Spider-Man continues!
Because you demanded it, here comes the sixth web-slinging, oversized Omnibus edition of The Amazing Spider-Man! What does it have in store for you? The entire creative run of Marv Wolfman, a bevy of rarities from F.O.O.M. like profiles on Spider-Man greats Stan Lee and John Romita, complete 1978 Mighty Marvel Comics Calendar starring Spider-Man, letters pages, house ads, original art and, oh yeah, some of the greatest Spider-Man stories of all time. We couldn’t forget Peter Parker’s marriage proposal to Mary Jane (will she say “yes”?!?), debut of the Black Cat, the return of the Burglar, a resurgent Kingpin and a war with the underworld that brings the Punisher back to action. These are stories that prove why Spider-Man is Marvel’s most enduring icon!

Wolverine gets called away from Jubilee's hiding place by Jean Grey before he can find anything. Sabretooth remains behind, however, and begins to sniff something out. Wolverine arrives at the Inner Circle chambers where Forearm lies done, having been killed after going through a strange portal, his body returning with a message. The message reads that Arkon has conquered Krakoa's sister island of Arakko and challenges the X-Men to a 10v10 sword duel for the fate of both islands. Cyclops isn't sure they should engage, but Apocalypse eagerly accepts the challenge. Apocalypse, Archangel, Rogue, Cyclops, Psylocke, Nightcrawler, Solarr, Silver Samurai, Shatterstar, and Storm go through the portal to confront Arkon, whose team includes the Brood Queen, Lady Deathstrike, Ms. Marvel, Arcade, the Horsemen of Apocalypse, Eric the Red, and Sauron.
On Krakoa, Forearm is revived by the Resurrection Protocols, but comes back further mutated and angry, so Beast goes to warn the others that dying in Arkon's realm makes you come back wrong. In Arkon's realm, Solarr is quickly killed while Rogue spars with Ms. Marvel, who seems to want revenge for Rogue stealing her powers. Psylocke finds out that the Brood Queen is actually a mech piloted by Deadpool, who almost tells Psylocke about the Jubilee thing before Beast breaks in to warn the others. However, Deadpool's mech falls and crushes Beast and Silver Samurai, killing them both. Wolverine kills Lady Deathstrike, who reveals in her last words that Trask is still alive. Apocalypse and Arkon then face off, but Arkon is killed from behind by Genesis, Apocalypse's wife and queen of Arakko.
Genesis and Apocalypse send the Arakko mutants to live on Krakoa, while Apocalypse and Archangel stay behind to help Arakko rebuild from Arkon's takeover. Back on Krakoa, X-Force stands guard as Silver Samurai, Solarr, and Beast are resurrected wrong again, but Beast assures that everything is fine. Xavier and Magneto, meanwhile, plan to go to space to make space for all the Arakko mutants.
XCII OF SWORDS!

OnEarth-31,Sergei Kravenoffcompletes a ritual before hunting inZimbabwefor a legendary lion, only to find it already dead. Pounced upon, Kraven is bitten by a massive spider larger than the lion, but Kraven is the hunter and slays his quarry. Three months later,J. Jonah Jamesonuses his own fortune to hire the "Hunter-Spider" to take down the beast men supervillains ofNew York City, with the first defeated being theRhino. Mounting the other animal themed villains on his wall, Kraven muses on how might the people feel seeing his prizes. However, he soon finds himself beset by a swarm of wasps, smelling they carry a deadly toxin that can transmute his being and poison his psyche... were he an ordinary man. With his potions augmenting his senses and immune system, along with the spider venom, Kraven consumes the wasps and transmutes them into added power for himself. At the Spider Sanctuary,Madame Webtalks withArañaandSpider-UKbefore Hunter-Spider finds them, willing to join as a warrior againstShathra, seeking a formidable prey. As Madame Web emphasizes that she is formable and deadly, Kraven is eager to join to put down that beast.

OnEarth-71490, a fashionably lateCooper Coenarrives late to a few reschedule dates and tells them what he can about himself; however, he omits his beingWeb-Weaver. Recalling his origins to himself, Cooper saved classmatePeter Parkerfrom aradioactive spiderbite, which endowed Cooper with spider powers soon after. Kicked out by his parents when he came out, Cooper was taken in by his auntsLaurieandMel, who encouraged him to achieve his dream to become a fashion designer underJanet Van Dyne, where Peter also came to work as a photographer and the two became roommates. Arriving at work after another cut-short date, Kenny shows Cooper a social media post ofSilver SablinovawithNorthstarfounder,Jean-Paul Beaubier, and his turncoat ex-boyfriend,Albert Moon. When Janet arrives, she's informed that Sablinova has agreed to be their model, but Janet's behavior is immediately suspect when she doesn't throw a tantrum. In her office, Janet is actually a bound and gagged hostage to an unknown impersonator.
At night, Web-Weaver patrols the city and comes upon a convenience store robbery only to find the other spider vigilante Silk resolved the matter before his arrival. After some flirtation, Web-Weaver and Silk take their leave, with Web-Weaver crestfallen at making responsible choices. After his colleagues chastise Cooper's tardiness, his Web-Sense flips and he fibs an excuse to leave, much to the annoyance of Fitz. When "Janet" arrives, she speaks withMillie Collinsin private, only to knock her out and assume her appearance. Outside, an uneasy Web-Weaver observes the runway and tries not to focus on Albert in the seats, then catches Millie acting as though she'd never strut before and attacks seeing a clawed hand morph out. As the crowd evacuates, "Millie" reveals herself to beChameleonhired to kill Sablinova, but Web-Weaver uses his web shooters to capture Chameleon, and is distracted hearing Peter call out for help. Thankfully, Albert saves Peter and Chameleon is stuck in a web trap, butSpider-UKcomes through a portal seeking Web-Weaver for help saving the multiverse-- and maybe give new threads forAraña. Initially refusing, Albert convinces him to go as he has a friend who'll handle clean up, and the two part with a kiss.

Syllie Spider. A 1919 cartoon character, created byP.T. Parker, who broke the fourth wall in his newspaper comic to enter the "real" world of Parker'sreality. SeeingJ. Jonah Jamesonmistreat Parker, Syllie threw a brick at him and befriended a fly he was going to eat to see the world. Soon after,Madame WebandSpider-UKfound him to ask for help, and he was taken aback by their being in color.
Three brand new Spiders get their start here!
• WEB-WEAVER: A not-so-mild mannered fashion designer at Van Dyne gets spider-powers and shows us a very different kind of Spider-Slayer.
• HUNTER-SPIDER: Imagine a world where Sergei Kravinoff got Spider-Powers. You are not ready for the most hardcore Spider yet!

Jublilee explains that in her first life, she was killed by a Sentinel before ever realizing she was a mutant. She was then reborn with all her memories, but was killed by a Sentinel again. In her third life she finally met the X-Men, but no matter what she did, the Sentinels always won. In her ninth life, she and Nimrod learned that she only had one life left, and then Nimrod killed her. In the present, she stays hidden away on Krakoa, knowing both that her death was necessary to unite mutantkind and that it would all fall apart if they discovered her ruse.
While Rogue takes a team to bring more mutants to Krakoa, Beast works in a lab with Mr. Sinister, who is secretly working on a Chimera Project. At a sparring match, Sabretooth tries to be friendly with Wolverine, but Wolverine isn't having any of it. He goes to see Jean Grey, who is connected to all the training and projects happening on Krakoa. She is then called off to an Inner Circle meeting, while Wolverine secretly goes to investigate Jubilee's death.
At the Inner Circle meeting, Xavier lies to the other leaders of Krakoa that the X-Men's mission to the Master Mold satellite was a success. The Orchis Council then sends a multi-headed, multi-armed Sentinel to attack Krakoa. Cyclops has Jean rally all the nearby mutants to fight back and protect Krakoa, then destroys the Sentinel thanks to Fabian Cortez supercharging his optic blast. As Cyclops claims that Krakoa works, Orchis receives all of the data on the mutants the Sentinel took while it was attacking. Wolverine then sniffs his way to Jubilee's hiding place, trailed by Sabretooth.
DAWN OF XCII!

Jubilee is upset that she can't go to the Inner Circle Gala, a big party on Krakoa where select outsiders, aka other superheroes, are invited to Krakoa for the first time. As superheroes mingle, Jean and Cyclops announce that Krakoa is changing its X-Men roster, with every X-Man chosen by a psychic vote. While the vote is going on, Sabretooth goes to see Mr. Sinister, who had hired him to look into Krakoa's secrets. However, Sabretooth instead finds Mr. Sinister tied up by Beast, who has ambitious plans for Krakoa now that his resurrection has freed him of morals.
Back at the Gala, the new X-Men team is chosen, consisting of Cyclops, Jean Grey, Rogue, Feral, Sunfire, Random, and Polaris. Then to finish the Gala off, Jean harnesses the power of the Phoenix Force for creation instead of destruction, and works with some other powerful mutants to create Asteroid X, a space habitat for the mutants of Arakko. Wolverine tells Cyclops that the Phoenix Force is trouble and that he's becoming rotten.
At Orchis HQ, Trask, in the body of a Sentinel, claims that mutants are better than humans, which means the only thing left to stop the mutants is the machines. Trask then proceeds to kill the rest of Orchis before making his way towards Earth. Meanwhile, having stormed off from the Gala, Wolverine catches Sabretooth's scent and tracks it to Jubilee's hiding ground. There, he finds that Beast, Sabretooth, and the other mutants resurrected from Arkon's realm have captured Jubilee and know her secret.
REIGN OF XCII!

Peter Porker, the Spectacular Spider-Ham (and breakout character from Into the Spider-Verse), arrives in this all-new, original graphic novel for younger readers!
Experience a laugh-out-loud day in the life of Spider-Ham! After long being derided by the citizens of New York, Spider-Ham has finally been recognized for his outsized contribution to the city's safety, and receives the key to the city from none other than the mayor (and, being a cartoon universe, the key actually unlocks New York City's political and financial institutions). Sure, it's just a publicity stunt for the beleaguered mayor-and yeah, maybe every single other super hero was busy that day -- but an award is an award!
Of course, Spider-Ham isn't paying attention to the fine print telling him he didn't actually get to keep the key, and he swings off without returning the highly coveted oversized object. The next day, when the mayor's office finally gets in touch to ask for the key back, Spider-Ham realizes he must have dropped it sometime in the last 24 hours. YIKES.

Storm is hosting a diplomatic meeting with Lilandra of the Shi'ar on Asteroid X when it is attacked by Trask inside of a Nimrod Sentinel. Trask easily defeats the Shi'ar Imperial Guard and X-Men before making his way to Krakoa, where Beast suggests using one of Mr. Sinister's Chimeras to stop him. The Inner Circle is against the unregulated use of cloning in the Chimera, but ultimately has no choice when nothing else is working against Trask. The Chimera arrives and teleports Trask into the Sun, seemingly killing them both.
With Trask gone, everyone turns their attention to Beast, who explains that the Chimeras can use shapeshifting to replace political leaders and take over the world, ensuring mutant supremacy. Xavier tells Beast that Krakoa is a peaceful nation and that the X-Men will stop him, but Beast assures Xavier that the Chimeras have already taken over. The X-Men also learn that Beast has Wolverine and Jubilee, forcing Xavier to explain to everyone what Jubilee's deal is.
Nobody is happy about Xavier lying, but they decide they have to deal with it later since Jubilee is dying, which means this is their last chance to preserve Krakoa. Things are made even worse when Trask returns, somehow alive, and starts attacking everyone.  Jean goes to unleash the Phoenix Force, but Jubilee realizes that it could give her one last use of her resurrection powers. Jean warns Jubilee that this will probably erase her secondary mutation and all memories of her past lives, but Wolverine tells her that as long as the X-Men have a fighting chance, they'll figure something out.
Jubilee decides that it's worth the risk and, using the power of the Phoenix Force, resets the universe again. With no memories of her past life, she plays arcade games in a mall, hoping that she isn't a mutant.
THE FINAL DESTINY OF XCII?

Cyclops, Jean Grey, Storm, Wolverine, Rogue, Gambit, Bishop, Beast, Children of the Atom, students of Charles Xavier, MUTANTS-feared and hated by the world they have sworn to protect. These are the STRONGEST heroes of all--these are the X-MEN.
Mutant hater Henry Peter Gyrich publicly attacked the team's founder, Charles Xavier, outing him as a mutant and dealing him a fatal injury, While the world believes Xavier dead, the truth is far stranger. The X-Men still find themselves without his guidance for the first time in a world shaken by his supposed death.
THE OFFICIAL PRELUDE TO THE HOTLY ANTICIPATED DISNEY+ SHOW!

The next question asked by the being is "What's the most dangerous Venom out there?" the Eventuality warned them that they were getting repetitive but then decided that it was natural for them to get curious. The Eventuality informed them that there was a scientist on Earth-71490 who asked that exact question and had it answered too before showing them.
The Eventuality then explains that he sent the V-Star Symbiote from its reality to Earth-71490 believing it could become that earth's lethal protector. He ponders on maybe if he was wrong and doomed the entire Multiverse but decides life is worth the risk. The Eventuality is then asked what if a more dangerous Venom isn't a more alien symbiote but a less human host, so they decide to take a look at the Venomsaurus Rex.
The Eventuality wonders if eating another dinosaur in the V-Rex's friend group counts as cannibalism given most of the friend group was made of other dinosaurs. The Eventuality then comes to the conclusion that it's still very rude to eat someone in your circle even if it isn't cannibalism but clarifies that's yet to happen yet as a human gets stepped on in that universe but it likely happens every day. The Eventuality is then asked if it is based on the universe in the first place, maybe a younger Venom would be worse.
The Eventuality then declares that Marcus Smith the Venom just seen is the worst Venom. However, he then notes that there are many bad Venoms and that if it weren't for him they would likely destroy the Multiverse. However, he notes that all the most dangerous universes don't have a Venom or King in Black they instead having something much worse, he then notes that the being in front of him has only two final questions.

Web-Weaver prepares to protect Doctor Stromm when he is stopped by Silk, Silk decides to tell Web-Weaver of his backstory. Long ago, his family entered into experimental technology in which a symbiote possessed their father, however the symbiote was too dangerous and killed Silk's mother and father and then possessed Silk and his sister Cindy. With their parents dead and a symbiote slowly to possess and corrupt them the company that was experimenting on their family took them in and experimented on them and the symbiote. Given Albert suffered the most under his, Cindy took majority of the load off of him, Albert later developed crime fighting abilities and took his mantel of Silk while Cindy became more powerful under her symbiote and began to change. Eventually Cindy was used in an attempt open a rtal to the V-Star symbiote's home-world but this seemingly killed both Cindy and the V-Star but Silk did not believe that.
Web-Weaver sympathized with Silk but still believed they needed to save the scientists V-Star was killing. However, before Web-Weaver could do anything, V-Star burst through the window holding the now deceased corpse of Mendel Stromm. V-Star was then attacked by S.H.I.E.L.D. and prepared to fight back despite being zapped by electricity until Silk told her not to. At which point V-Star flew away, when director Misty Knight asked what that was, Silk referred to V-Star as his protector.

Venomsaurus Rex comically brags about having a symbiote, however aDromiceiomimusis concerned V-Rex could start to have urges to eat brains. V-Rex explains that he believes that's the best part, with the symbiote none of the brain-eating urges are his fault and therefore he gets a "Get out of jail free card". V-Rex then brags about having eaten brains much to the disturbance of his friend who begins to distance himself from him. V-Rex then makes multiple double meanings to get his friend to become his dinner but his friend is well aware of their meaning much to V-Rex's disappointment.

On Earth-197629, Venom is a hero known for being a bit lethal but he gets the job done having killed Captain America after his secret empire was revealed. However, some people are not convinced Venom is totally redeemed until at least he meets with his biggest fan, cancer patient Marcus Smith. Venom meets with Marcus and the two reminisce about Venom's past adventures like how he killed Spider-Man on Christmas and then cleaned up the remains of his corpse with a Zamboni. Marcus suggests he dig Spider-Man back up and kill him again. However, Venom believes digging someone back up to kill them again is Kraven's thing more so than Venom. Marcus then suggests Venom bonds with him to get rid of his sickness so the two can go on adventures together. Venom refuses given he's not one for sidekicks, Marcus then asks for Venom to at least bond a little to him which Venom decides to let happen.
However, suddenly Venom begins to leave Eddie for Marcus at which point Marcus revealed he wasn't talking to Eddie but the symbiote. Venom leaves Eddie for Marcus given that he evidently sees he can conquer his true potential within the child. Marcus then rips the cancer out of himself and leaves it in Eddie, Marcus then leaves with the symbiote to do things Eddie supposedly couldn't do. J. Janet Jameson then says that Eddie can only be a hero if he meets with the child on the TV and Eddie remembering that he listened to her which led him to this mess curses at the TV.
A VENOM FOR EVERY UNIVERSE!

The X-Men arrive on the Master Mold satellite to both destroy it and prevent Bolivar Trask from sending a signal. While Wolverine hunts down Trask, the other X-Men engage in battle with a bunch of Sentinels. Gambit accidentally kills himself and Rogue by blowing a hole in the satellite walls. Beast is killed soon after when the Blackbird spacecraft is destroyed, followed by Cyclops being obliterated by a laser beam. Wolverine confronts Trask and claims to want revenge for something terrible that happened to Jubilee, but Wolverine's gloating takes too long and Trask is able to send the signal before being killed. Sensing that they have failed, Jean Grey orders Magneto to destroy the satellite. He does so easily, but dies along with the remaining X-Men in the process.
On Earth, in New York's Krakoan Embassy, Psylocke explains to Robert Kelly, Vindicator, and Henry Peter Gyrich how the X-Men founded Krakoa as a safe-haven for all mutants without hurting any humans, and how they intend to keep that peace for everyone's future. The embassy is then attacked by the Friends of Humanity who still want to kill the mutants, so Psylocke calls in Cable and X-Force via a Krakoan portal to deal with them. She is then called back to Krakoa where the X-Men who died on the Master Mold satellite have been revived, thanks to the mutants' new Resurrection Protocols that let them cheat death. Xavier further explains that Krakoa is an island paradise for mutants, where old grudges are put aside and all are friends. Despite everybody else being happy about it, Wolverine is pissed off that it took the death of Jubilee to unite everyone.
Xavier and Magneto then go see Jubliee, who is hiding in a secret bunker after faking her death to unite everyone. She reveals that she's lived 10 lives, and every time the Orchis Protocols get set up, everything comes crashing down. In space, Trask, now in a Sentinel's body, has assembled Orchis, including Henry Peter Gyrich and Lady Deathstrike, to crush the mutants once and for all.
THE '90s ARE BACK — AGAIN!

Tombstoneinforms the otherNew Yorkcrime bosses ofhis daughter'swedding, noting that none of them responded to the invitation. They don't want to go for fear ofKingpin'sreaction and because they think Tombstone is weakening. Tombstone finally convinces them to go, butHammerheadis planning something.Black Cat,White Rabbittand theSyndicateattend Janice's bachelorette party, whileRandygoes toAtlantic CitywithPeterfor his bachelor party. However, there are only the two of them and Peter claims he forgot to invite the others and Randy leaves angry... only to find out that Peter had invited everyone in advance and that his friends don't want to come to the wedding because they think he's doing it wrong marrying a supervillain. Randy then states that even though he's usually a mess, when things matter, Peter is his best friend. While talking to Janice about being with a good guy, Felicia realizes that she and Peter are forcing themselves to make their relationship work, so she decides to end it. On the day of the wedding, amysterious manshoots Tombstone, with bullets capable of wounding him. Spider-Man manages to scare him away, and the guests escape, but the wedding is now postponed.

Secret War by Brian Michael Bendis Omnibus#1Previous IssueNext Issue——Release DateApril 1, 2025Cover DateApril,2025Issue DetailsEditor-in-ChiefC.B. CebulskiOriginal Price$75Pages368ISBN978-1302963828
One of the darkest chapters in Marvel history beings as Nick Fury assembles a covert team of heroes for an unthinkable mission!
When Nick Fury discovers a disturbing connection between many of Marvel's deadliest villains, he assembles a ragtag team of the MU's most misunderstood heroes for a secret mission to do what the U.S. government could never allow — eventually leading to a super-powered blowout between a who's who of costumed crimefighters! We’re talking Captain America, Daredevil, Spider-Man, Black Widow, Wolverine and more! But as they come under attack by groups of high-tech villains, what is Nick Fury's secret — and will the heroes find out in time? In the aftermath, Luke Cage is missing, and Jessica Jones will do whatever she can to find him. But who are the mystery men following her? And will her life ever recover from the drama of Secret War?

The Silver Surfer soars through the depths of space once again in this brand new omnibus collecting his 80s adventures!
After years trapped on Earth, the Silver Surfer finally breaks free of Galactus's barrier and returns to the stars! His full Power Cosmic restored, he heads for Zenn-La. But the old saying holds true: You can't go home again. While the age-old war between the Kree and the Skrulls heats up once again, the Elders of the Universe target Galactus! But love is the greatest force of all. Will Surfer find it with his old flame, Shalla-Bal? With Galactus's herald Nova? Or with the Celestial Madonna, Mantis? Plus: The origin of Galactus! A blockbuster team-up with the Fantastic Four! Ego the Living Planet! And a stunning collaboration between the legendary Stan Lee and the visionary Moebius, wherein the only one who can stop Galactus from leading mankind to its doom is the Silver Surfer!

All your favorite super heroes — plus some of Marvel’s horror icons — star in extra-length adventures that gave comic fans of the 1970s even more bang for their buck! Atlas Comics Library HC#6: Shiver As You Read!Previous IssueNext IssueAtlas Comics Library HC: Police Action—Reprint of animagefromMen's Adventures#26. Original art by:Russ HeathandStan GoldbergRelease DateApril 22, 2025Cover DateApril,2025Issue DetailsOriginal Price$44.99Pages304ISBN979-8875000577
Pulp horror classics from the 1950s! Revenge, ghosts, locked rooms and killer ants, taken from early Marvel Comics series Men’s Adventures and Amazing Detective Cases.
The 1950s boom in horror comics saw Atlas Comics' entrée into the genre. Beginning in March 1952, Amazing Detective Cases began detailing cases where justice was served in supernatural fashion and beginning in May 1953, the adventures in Men’s Adventures were taken over by ghosts, murderous revenge, and psychological terror. The cream of Atlas’ artistic line-up — including recent EC stars and future Marvel staples – rose to the grisly challenge of the horror genre. Each issue is crammed with four condensed tales of creeping dread, ironic comeuppance, or startling twists, all from a different artist or team.
Among the short, sharp shocks included in this volume are the mini masterpieces "The Eerie Escape" by B. Krigstein, "The Torture Master!" by Russ Heath, The Drowning Witch" by Reed Crandall and "The 3rd Corpse" by Bill Everett. Stories by Gene Colan, John Romita, Joe Sinnott, Dick Ayers, Jim Mooney, Paul Reinman and George Tuska, all of whom remained through the shift to Marvel Comics, additionally fill out these issues, along with Atlas regulars Fred Kida, Mort Lawrence, Mike Sekowsky and Myron Fass. Notably included is the first appearance of "Gorilla Man" by Robert Q. Sale, a character brought back in Marvel's contemporary Agents of Atlas series, and part of their ongoing continuity.

Kingpin’s hitmen are closing in, your girlfriend—who doesn’t even want to know the real you—broke up with you, and your new alien costume wants to kill you. What’s that, you say? World Gone Sane
Visionary creator Steve Gerber takes the Defenders on one of the most creative and beloved superteam eras of all time!
Marvel has never had a bigger team of misfits than the Defenders and the Defenders have never had a more exciting and innovative writer than Steve Gerber. Known as a “non-team” book,The Defenders’ left room for experimentation that other titles lacked. From the Elf-with-a-Gun to Bambi and the Bozos, Steve Gerber used that space to push boundaries and craft a challenging critique of the era’s culture. His stories are brought to life by the art team of Sal Buscema and Klaus Janson as the Headmen Saga reaches an action-packed and insightful conclusion. This collection of classics is topped it off withMarvel Treasury Edition#12’s much-adored Defenders/Howard the Duck team-up.
COLLECTING: THE DEFENDERS (1972) #26-41, GIANT-SIZE (1974) #5 & ANNUAL (1976) #1 and MARVEL TREASURY EDITION (1974) #12.

May 1965 marked the debut of Nick Fury, agent of SHIELD — and this omnibus collects the entire publishing slate from that month, in this time capsule of an omnibus!
Marvel proudly celebrates the 60th anniversary of Stan Lee and Jack Kirby's S.H.I.E.L.D. with an Omnibus collecting every Marvel comic released in May 1965, the month Nick Fury's super-hero spy thriller debuted! It's the next step in the evolution of the Marvel Universe, one that's increasingly being taken over by innovative super heroes. But the there's still plenty to be had in the pages of Patsy Walker and Millie the Model as those titles adapt to the ever-swinging Sixties. While over on the range in Two-Gun Kid, the Western villain the Panther seems like a fantastic idea. May 1965 also featured the beginning of Namor the Sub-Mariner — Marvel's original antihero — in his Tales to Astonish solo series. Take a trip back in time and experience the whole of the Marvel Universe with the Marvel: May 1965 Omnibus!

The Itsy-Bitsy Spider
The deadly Yelena Belova lays claim to the title of Black Widow in a foundational tale set in the start of the modern era of comics!
Natasha Romanoff has always led a life of adventure. A former Soviet spy, she defected to the West and became a super hero and an Avenger. Natasha has earned a reputation as a consummate professional, coldly efficient and as deadly as her namesake. But now, her time as Black Widow may be running out! Yelena Belova is the first student in the history of the Red Room to exceed Natasha's skills -—and now she's gunning for the mantle she feels was stolen from her. Plus: A string of international killings leads Natasha back to a Russia she can barely recognize. Whoever said you can't go home again never reckoned with the Black Widow! And when Yelena’s former mentor is murdered, she must go deep undercover to catch the killer!
COLLECTING: Black Widow (1999) 1-3, Black Widow (2001) 1-3, Black Widow: Pale Little Spider (2002) 1-3, Black Widow (2004) 1-6, Black Widow: The Things They Say About Her (2005) 1-6

Battered and bruised,Spider-Manstands on the roof of an apartment and pulls off his mask, mentally recapping how Alfred Nobel founded the Nobel Peace Prize to atone for his invention of dynamite after coming across a prematurely-printed obituary labelling him the "Merchant of Death" and celebrating his purported demise. Gazing around at the horrors wrought byKnull'sinvasion of Earth, Peter Parker despairs that this is all his fault for having brought theVenom symbioteto Earth. Trying to avoid having a panic attack, Peter slams his fist into the wall of a rooftop exit as he thinks to himself that every death that Venom,Carnage, and the other symbiotes have caused is on him - and now the world is ending because he was patient zero for the symbiote invasion of Earth. As he gets himself under control, something swoops past and Peter turns to see a winged shape carrying an elderly woman in its talons. Pulling his torn mask back on, Spider-Man leaps into action - chastising himself for forgetting he's on the clock  and quipping that fighting asymbiote-dragonshouldn't be much different from fighting theVulture- which he's been doing since he was a teenager.
Catching up to the winged shape, Spider-Man punches it... only to belatedly notice it's not a symbiote-dragon but the teenaged shapeshifterReptilin the form of aPteranodon. Catching Reptil and the elderly woman in a webbing net, Spider-Man apologizes for his mistake, the old woman - a Mrs. Volkov - furiously calling him a threat and a menace. Spider-Man asks what Reptil is doing in New York when last he'd heard he was a student at theAvengers Academy, but Reptil remarks the Academy has been closed for years. As Reptil remarks that it's Spider-Man's fault he's in New York, Peter's heart-rate spikes... until Reptil says that Spider-Man is one of his chief heroic inspirations, always looking out for the little guy. Reptil says one thing he learned fromHenry Pymwas to always be aware of his limitations, turning to indicate the symbiote-controlledCelestialstowering over the city and saying there's no way he could handle them. As Reptil says he's just a guy who can turn into dinosaurs, Spider-Man half-jokingly asks if he wants to trade power-sets; Reptil ignoring him and saying that what he learned from Spider-Man is that saving people is more important than fighting people. As they talk, Mrs. Volkov pulls out her smartphone and announces there's no signal; Reptil telling Spider-Man he's trying to get her to her home because that's what Spider-Man would do. Stunned and impressed, Spider-Man thinks to himself that there's nothing more he can do forEddieorDylan Brockbefore offering to help.
With Mrs. Volkov secured to Reptil's back with webbing, the two heroes set off across the city - Reptil asking if Spider-Man's sure he doesn't have anywhere more important to be. Spider-Man says Reptil is right that they need to be mindful of their capabilities before asking Mrs. Volkov where she lives. The elderly woman glares at him, Reptil remarking that she's a fan of the classicDaily Buglebefore asking Spider-Man where Staten Island is. Spider-Man is shocked, Reptil remarking that he's from Nevada and doesn't know his way around New York City. Spider-Man explains that Staten Island is five miles off the coast of Manhattan, Reptil remarking that he can fly them both there. Coming across a swarm of symbiote-dragons, Spider-Man thinks to himself that he was losing focus due to the overwhelming odds and that Reptil is right that he should concentrate on doing what he can. Blinding the symbiote-dragons with webbing, Spider-Man distracts them long enough for Reptil to get past them, snaring Reptil's talon with a web-line. Pulled along, Spider-Man thinks to himself that he's just a guy from Queens with radioactive spider-blood, but that even if this is all his fault he can do his part by helping those he can. Out over the New York Bay, Reptil asks Spider-Man for directions and Spider-Man points to the Staten Island ferry - thinking to himself that in the total darkness of Knull's symbiote-dome it's like flying in space, making the ferry's lights like a lighthouse beacon. As they draw closer, however, Spider-Man is horrified to realize they're not the only ones drawn to the ferry's lights: a colossal symbiote-dragon lands on the ferry and roars. As Reptil asks what they should do, Spider-Man thinks to himself that there's no way they can fight it before saying out loud that they have no choice but to fight it in order to save the people on the ferry.  Reptil says he can't turn into a flying creature big enough to fight the colossal symbiote-dragon, Spider-Man musing that aTyrannosaurus rexwouldn't work either given the harbor before coming up with an idea.
Taking Mrs. Volkov, Spider-Man leaps down to the ferry and greets the crew, saying that he and Reptil are there to help. As the crew expresses incredulity as to what a kid who can turn into dinosaurs can do against the colossal symbiote-dragon, Reptil dives into the water and transforms into aMosasaurus- lunging up out of the water and chomping down on the colossal symbiote-dragon's neck before dragging it underwater. As the captain celebrates, Spider-Man says all Reptil did was buy them some time and that the only way to put the colossal symbiote-dragon down for good is with high voltages of electricity. The captain boasts that his ship is a brand-new Ollis-class ferry with four massive diesel engines and emergency generators capable of putting out 400,000 kilowatts; Spider-Man grinning and saying that'll do the trick. As they head below deck, the passengers accost them - demanding the captain launch the lifeboats to get them away from the monsters outside and disparagingly wondering what good a street-level hero like Spider-Man can do against the colossal symbiote-dragon. As Spider-Man's anxiety and PTSD start to overwhelm him, Mrs. Volkov shouts for the other passengers to shut up. The elderly woman states that Spider-Man could have decided to just save her and leave the colossal symbiote-dragon for the likes ofThororCaptain Marvelsince there was no way he could fight it on his own, but that to her surprise he told Reptil that they need to save as many people as possible.
As Spider-Man delivers a rousing speech and jury-rigs a harpoon to the ship's generators, the colossal symbiote-dragon overpowers Reptil'sMosasaurusform and takes a bite out of his neck before heading for the surface. As the colossal symbiote-dragon breaks the surface and glares at him, Spider-Man - thinking to himself that it's his responsibility to help clean up the mess he created and that he isn't afraid anymore - quotes Captain Ahab's last words fromMoby Dickbefore leaping into the colossal symbiote-dragon's gaping jaws. Spider-Man stabs the electrified harpoon into its tongue, causing it to destabilize and rupture - spattering the ferry with black ichor. As the captain celebrates, Spider-Man asks where Reptil is - the teenage hero landing on the deck and announcing he's still alive. As the two heroes congratulate each other, Mrs. Volkov says she's glad Reptil isn't seriously injured but that she'll be taking the ferry the rest of the way home. Taking a breather, Reptil asks Spider-Man what they do next, and Spider-Man says they go back out there and keep saving people.

Mysteriant interrupts a meeting of high level executives from many corporations held at Oscorp,  introducing the new Sinister Six and demanding to make right their capitalist crimes against society. Squid Kid menaces over Norman Osborn until Red Goblin crashes in, entering battle with the vengeful Willow-Wisp, as Liz Allen, empowered by the Misery symbiote, takes on Rhinoceress before both are handily dispatched. Squid Kid’s sonic disruptors leave Red Goblin completely helpless, as Lizard Boy returns from his mission to kidnap Stanley Osborn from the employee daycare for his Goblin blood, much to the disdain of Mysteriant and Willow Wisp. Red Goblin watches, defeated, as the Sinister Six escape with his little brother.

Arcade rants about being the greatest assassin in the world and punishes Elektra with his giant killer robot suit. But then Lauren appears, wearing Screwball’s helmet which allows her to control some aspects of the game. She frees Elektra from being pinned down and powers her up with samurai armor and weapons.
From this points Elektra easily overpowers and destroys Arcade’s combat suit. He tries to teleport away into his private office but Elektra follows and apprehends him. She says she should kill him but first wants to know who he is working for. He says it was never a coincidence that she was captured; she was marked all along, with several other heroes that Arcade has recently tormented, by the Kingpin. Arcade is arrested and Lauren boards a bus to Pittsburgh.
Elektra returns to NYC, feeling it must be her fate to “continue the circle of death” with Kingpin, Daredevil, and Bullseye.
HUNT OR BE HUNTED!
• The epic climax of “ALWAYS BET ON RED”!
• Trapped in MURDERWORLD, ELEKTRA is close to ending ARCADE’s sick games.

THE MARVEL UNIVERSE COLLIDES WITH FORTNITE!
The inhabitants on the Island are locked in what seems like a never-ending war, and only one thing has the potential to turn the tide – a crystallized fragment of the Zero Point that was cast into the Marvel Universe. Spider-Man and Wolverine team up with several Fornite fighters and new recruit Shuri to hunt down the elusive Zero Shard. Will these allies be able to find it in time and avert catastrophe? And can the heroes of the Marvel and Fortnite realities hold off the Imagined Order long enough to give them a fighting chance?

Recalling how it bonded toSpider-Manduring theSecret Wars, theVenom symbiotebitterly reflects on how its host had rejected it with the help ofMister Fantastic, leaving it imprisoned in theFantastic Four's headquarters.
Entering Reed Richards' lab,Ben Grimm, the ever-lovin' blue-eyed Thing, grumbles that Reed was supposed to meet him at the crash site, wondering how the smartest man in the world could forget such an important day. Hearing the sound of something hitting glass, Ben pulls back a sheet from a glass vitrine to reveal the symbiote, marvelling at the amorphous creature and wondering if it's alive. Entering the lab, Reed concurs -- though he doubts it's sentient -- and states that it is a symbiotic alien life form that was unwittingly brought to Earth by Spider-Man. Reed states that he decided to study the symbiote, the lab's new security protocols warding off attempted break-ins to steal it. Interrupting, Ben pointedly states that Reed forgot their anniversary, but Reed says he didn't -- he just decided to give Ben time to process things on his own time, having just recently returned from space. Shooting Reed an disbelieving look, Ben tells him to just admit he feels guilty for turning him into a monster. Turning to regard the symbiote, Ben sarcastically asks Reed why he doesn't stick him in a specimen cage too. Reed assures Ben that he's doing everything in his power to find a cure, but is interrupted by his wifeSue Storm, who informs him he's late for an interview. As he departs, Reed invites Ben to join the team for dinner, saying thatShe-Hulkis going to try making lasagna. Saying he'll check his schedule, Ben sighs dejectedly and laments to the symbiote that Reed will never understand what it's like being him. As Ben talks about how hurtful it is to be treated like a monster no matter how much good he does, the symbiote leers at him and then headbutts the side of the canister. As Ben says he can't let it out, the symbiote thinks to itself that despite his strong body Ben is weak inside -- the makings of a perfect host. Realizing the symbiote is offering to help him if he helps it, Ben opens the canister and it bonds to him.
Returning to check on Ben, Reed is horrified at the sight of the symbiote-augmented Thing. Reaching for his sonic gun, Reed explains that when Spider-Man was its host the symbiote enhanced his powers but affected his mind. Retorting that the symbiote wants to help, Ben uses its shapeshifting powers to transform into his original human form. Despite Ben's elation, Reed raises the sonic gun and grimly says this isn't the way. As Reed opens fire, Ben leaps out of the way and transforms into his symbiote-enhanced form, furiously accusing Reed of letting his ego get in the way of his friend's happiness. As Reed protests that that's not true and the symbiote is infecting him, the Symbiote Thing snatches the sonic gun away and crushes it, snapping that this is the first time he's felt himself since the accident. Telling Reed to stay out of his way, Ben transforms into his human form and storms out of the lab.
In the sewers, theLizardsenses the symbiote has escaped captivity and sets out to find it.
In the Baxter Building, Reed remarks to Sue that the symbiote is somehow able to stabilize Ben's molecules to reverse his transformation, and that it should be possible to remove it without reversing the transformation. As Sue tells Reed to figure it out after they've saved their friend, Reed remarking that the symbiote taps into its host's subconscious desires, lamenting that if he removes it he'll be taking away the one thing that's fulfilled Ben's desire to look human again. Sue retorts that the symbiote makes Ben a danger to himself and others, and that it's their responsibility to stop him even if he hates them for it, though Reed laments that it's his responsibility to be a monster so his friend doesn't lose his humanity.
Revelling in his return to human form, Ben cheerfully hits on attractive women and admires his reflection. The symbiote suddenly surges around Ben, alerting him to danger. Transforming into the Thing with the symbiote taking the shape of a sleeveless and legless uniform with a red spider emblem, Ben peers into a nearby alley as a sewer grate explodes skyward. As Ben prepares to fight, saying his foe is going to be sorry, the Lizard emerges and says the only thing he's sorry about is how the Fantastic Four have treated Ben. Bemused by the sudden appearance of one of Spider-Man's enemies, Ben resolves himself to fight and attacks despite the Lizard protesting that he just wants to talk. Punched into a wall, the Lizard hisses that his reptilian minions have told him all about how Ben is reviled as a monster and unloved even by the man who created him. As Ben grabs him by the throat and prepares to punch him in the face, the Lizard says that the Fantastic Four lied to him and only keep him around because they're afraid of him. As Ben stammers that the Lizard doesn't know that, Curt Connors' reptilian alter ego chuckles bitterly and says that people fear him based on his scales, fangs, claws, and tail, and reject him even when he tries to do good -- asking Ben if that sounds familiar. Ben snaps that Dr. Connors has hurt people both as a human and a humanoid reptile, releasing him and saying they're nothing alike. The Lizard retorts that the Thing will never be accepted as a hero without the Fantastic Four at his side, saying that he started with good intentions -- developing a means for amputees to regenerate lost limbs -- and succeeded by using himself as a test subject, even if he's rejected as a monster. The Lizard says he still wants to help people despite the world fearing and hating him, and that in the right hands Ben's symbiote could provide a cure for thousands of people.
As Ben thinks it over, the Lizard says that it sensed something special about Spider-Man's new suit on Battleworld but wasn't sure what it was until now, asking Ben to help him help people by sharing his gift. Descending into the Lizard's lair in the sewers, Ben enters a machine as the Lizard boots it up. Disparaging Reed Richards, the Lizard activates the machine, which separates the symbiote from Ben and sucks it up. Horrified, Ben says the Lizard said he wanted to use the symbiote to help others; the Lisard replying that he didn't lie -- he just meant himself. Saying he will give the world a reason to fear and hate him, the Lizard bonds to the symbiote.
At the Baxter Building, Sue suggests Reed call inJohnny Stormor She-Hulk instead of trying to do everything alone. Repairing the sonic gun, Reed says it has to be him, but Sue calls him out on being irrational. Their argument is interrupted by an alarm, and as Reed tries to get a visual feed of the intruder the Venomized Lizard bursts into the lab and collapses the floor. With Sue dazed and Reed distracted, the Lizard pounces on him and begins savagely beating him. Sue tries to defeat the Venomized Lizard with her powers, but he regenerates from her attacks and kills her. Grebbing Reed by the throat, the Lizard mocks him for having assumed he was the smartest scientist in Battleworld. In the sewers, Ben transforms back into the Thing and escapes, arriving just in time to see the Lizard bite off Reed's arm when he tries to throttle him into unconsciousness. Sneering that the Thing is too late, the Venomized Lizard bites off Reed's head. Horrified by the death of his friend, Ben apologizes for not having listened and for being so hard on him, the Venomized Lizard saying that Reed deserved to die for his selfishness and that he and Ben are better off now. His sorrow turning to rage, Ben declares that the Fantastic Four is no more and tackles the Venomized Lizard out the window. As they fall, the symbiote leaves the Lizard and rebonds to Ben, smug that it's succeeded in breaking and corrupting him. Impacting the ground, the symbiote-enhanced Thing picks up the Lizard by the head, Dr. Connors realizing his intent and saying it's not what Reed would want. Retorting that Reed's gone, the Thing crushes the Lizard's head and fully succumbs to the symbiote's influence. As the NYPD arrive, the Venomized Thing bares his fangs and lets out a roar.
WHAT IF…BEN GRIMM BECAME VENOM?
• When BEN GRIMM returns to Earth after his exploration of space post-SECRET WARS, he finds that the FANTASTIC FOUR has trapped a helpless Klyntar symbiote in Reed’s lab!
• But is that symbiote really helpless? Or is it truly one of the most dangerous symbiotes in the galaxy?

FEW SURVIVORS REMAIN…WHO WILL MAKE IT OUT ALIVE?!
• Three more sagas from the front lines of the zombie apocalypse – the final desperate remnants of humanity in a Marvel Universe full of horror!
• BLADE makes his last stand against evil in the stark, dangerous polar north! A lone PUNISHER faces down the horde…and the decision that very well may be his last! And SHANNA THE SHE-DEVIL battles the Savage Land in an onslaught that can only be described with two words: zombie dinosaurs!

Gwen Stacy of Earth-65 recaps what happened to Gwen Stacy of Earth-616 before coming back to being told she can't get an ID, because the only information she has presented is that her name is Gwen Stacy. The man at the desk tells her he can't give her an ID, as she has not presented anymore identification. and that if she can't he's gonna have to ask her to leave. Suddenly, robbers appear and, despite being told by the TVA not to use her suit or her powers, she does both and defeats the robbers earning the praise of the civilians. Gwen then heads back to the apartment, but as she does footage is caught of her confusing the Spider-Heroes of Earth-616, who wonder what she's doing on Earth-616. Upon arriving back on the apartment, she runs into Ouroborous, or "O.B." for short. O.B. reminds her of what they discussed before taking her to Earth-616.
Gwen tells him that she tried but that the suit has sort of a symbiotic feature, as it has mind of its own. O.B. suggests telling the suit the same thing he told her. Gwen also complains about having to use the alias "Lisa Rogers", as it feels like using a superhero alias while in a civilian life. O.B. understands and tells her he'll see what she can do, but reminds her one last time that under no circumstances can she use the suit, or else people will die. Gwen tries not to use the suit only to see a truck of armed robbers, and decides that she has no choice. Before going to stop them, though, she makes the rational that O.B. only told her not to use it on armed robbers, but said nothing of armed trucks, therefore finding a loophole.
She stops the truck, but is attacked by the Last Son of Kraven, who shoots her with a dart. Confused, Gwen recalls hearing that Kraven was dead, unaware that this is Kraven's clone/son. The two fight, but Gwen finds the dart is slowing her down and begins to hallucinate her Earth-616 counterpart's death. As she realizes that this is the very place her counterpart died, she is stabbed by Kraven, who hurls her over the bridge. As Gwen dies, she notes that her Earth-616 counterpart was loved and remembered, while she'll be dead and forgotten. As she sinks, an unknown person pulls her out of the water.
TRAPPED IN THE 616…FOR GOOD!

Mister FearGalleryNameLawrence "Larry" CranstonCurrent AliasMister FearAliasesHarold CranstoneAffiliation and RelationshipsAffiliationFisk's ThunderboltsFormerlyBroderick, Sloan and CranstonRelativesAlan Fagan(nephew),Ariel Tremmore(grandniece)Marital StatusSinglePhysical CharacteristicsGenderMaleHeight5′10″ (1.78 m)Weight150 lbs (68.04 kg)EyesIrises:BlueHairBrownOrigin and Living StatusOriginHumanLiving StatusAliveRealityEarth-616Personal InformationIdentityPublicCitizenshipAmericanOccupationProfessional criminal, lawyer, university professorEducationLaw degreeCreators and AppearancesCreatorsGerry Conway,Gene ColanFirstDaredevil#88(March, 1972)(as Lawrence Cranston)Daredevil#90(May, 1972)(as Mister Fear)
Ariel Tremmore(grandniece)
Irises:
Larry Cranston attended the same law school asMatt Murdock. He hated that Murdock was always praised at the school, and even defeated Larry in a mock trial.[1][2]
Cranston was a witness ofMister Fear (Zoltan Drago)'s murder. Drago asked him for help and revealed the location of his hidden caches. Unfortunately, Cranston was unable to help him as Drago died moments later.[1]
Obtaining Mister Fear's equipment, Cranston decided to take vengeance on Murdock. He noticed that both Murdock and Daredevil moved toSan Franciscoand suspected they were the same person. He convinced his partners at their law firmBroderick, Sloan and Cranstonto hire Murdock and then attacked him withFear Gas. Unfortunately, Daredevil defeated him and unmasked him. Trying to escape, Larry leaped from the building, forgetting his jets and seemingly falling to his death.[1]
Somehow, Cranston survived and secretly lived as a professor atColumbia Law Schoolas Harold Cranstone. Using the fear gas to take silent revenge on his colleagues, he later kidnappedBen Urichto ensnare Daredevil. He was defeated and escaped back into his alternate life as a professor, secretly sending agents likeInsomniaandGladiatorto attack Daredevil. He eventually sentCharles Boroughson a killing spree directed atKaren Page. When he failed to kill her, Cranston killed Borough's himself and attempted to have karen framed for the murder.[3]
Fear Inducement:By experimenting withFear GasCranston managed to infuse himself with its ability and now could induce fear into others without Gas.[5]

Tarantula's Organization[1]GalleryNameTarantula's Organization[1]AliasesFamily[2]MembersLeader(s)formerly Luis (Black Tarantula's cousin),Black TarantulaFormer Member(s)El Uno,Chesbro,Karsano,Madam Qwa,Master Zei,Yano,Dragonfly (Meiko Yin)Affiliation and IdentityIdentitySecretAlliesEnergy,U.S. Department of Defense,Don Fortunato,EnemiesTheRose,Spider-Man,Delilah,Hand,Alias InvestigationOrigin and StatusStatusActiveRealityEarth-616Base of OperationsArgentinaCreators and AppearancesFirstAmazing Spider-Man#419(November, 1996)
Black Tarantula's organization ran a criminal empire that operated in South America and parts of Europe. Which was involved in drug smuggling, theft, extortion, and murder.[3][2][4]It was a crime family which had ruledArgentinafor a thousand years.[5]Members either had a spider tattoo or wore a spider symbol on their clothing.[1][5]The organization had fanatical operatives, who were willing to die for their "deathless" master. Ritual suicide for failing was an option for these operatives.[6][7]When it expanded to theUnited States, a deal was made with the dominant crimelord ofNew York Cityat the timeDon Fortunato. In which they were allowed to setup operations in the city, getting the hijacking racket in exchange.[8]
The organization worked withRoxxon Energyand theU.S. Department of Defense, on a project to produce super-powered soldiers. It was in the nation ofBolivia, on land owned by Tarantula's organization and in a complex that used to be owned by theBrand Corporation. Roxxon funding was to the Black Tarantula's operations as were the super-powered soldiers that would have been produced by the facility.Spider-Manfollowed them to the Bolivian facility, where he battled the Scorpion, and during the fighting federal agents arrived. They arrested those at the facility, though the Black Tarantula got away.[1]

Captain Stacyof theNYPDwas the father ofGwen Stacy,Spider-Woman. He was forced to hunt down his own daughter after an encounter between her andPeter Parkerled to the latter's death. AfterAleksei Sytsevichwas sent to kill Stacy, Spider-Woman saved his life, and revealed to him her secret identity, making George change his views on the vigilante.[2]
After the attack, Stacy was relieved from the command of the NYPD'sSpecial Crimes Task ForcebyMayor J. Jonah Jameson, who feared Stacy would undercut him. George remained in an advisory capacity helpingFoggy Nelsonand the District Attorney's office until theVulturewould be caught.[4]
